meanings.definition: A set of changes that are intended to make a person or place more attractive or modern.
meanings.sent1: She got a makeover before the party to look more stylish.
meanings.sent2: The living room makeover included new furniture and paint.
meanings.sent3: The makeover of the old house made it the talk of the town.
meanings.sent4: Her makeover was like a magic spell transforming her appearance.
meanings.sent5: The makeover turned the plain room into a stunning space.

meanings.definition: To give a new and typically improved appearance to.
meanings.sent1: They decided to makeover the garden for a fresh look.
meanings.sent2: She wanted to makeover her wardrobe for the new season.
meanings.sent3: He tried to makeover his hairstyle but ended up with a funny look.
meanings.sent4: The city streets were being made over with new lights and signs.
meanings.sent5: The team worked hard to makeover the old building into a modern office.
